columns.text: In this exercise, we are asked to answer the following questions by applying the concept of *Translation Exposure.*
**Exchange rate risk** is the natural consequence in the international market where the value of the *currencies either increase or decrease.*

We are given the following data:

<center>


| | Arrakeen solaris| 
|--|:--:| 
| Assets| 38,000| 
|Liabilities |12,000 | 
| Equity|26,000 |

## a.

We are asked to determine how would the balance sheet look like if the current exchange ratio is 1.50 solaris per U.S. dollar.

In order to determine how would the balance sheet look like, we  will convert the assets, liabilities and equity in U.S. dollar. We will divide their values in solaris by the current exchange rate 1.50 solaris. To visualize: 
$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Value in \$} &= \dfrac{\text{Value in solaris}}{\text{Exchange Rate}}\\[10pt]
\end{aligned}$$

As a conclusion, the balance sheet will have a value of the assets, liabilities and equity of **$25,333, $8,000, and $17,333** respectively. To illustrate: 

$$\begin {array}{c}
\textbf{Atreides International}\\
\textbf{Balance Sheet}\\
\textbf{For the Year Ended 20YX}
\end{array}$$
$$\begin {array}{llr}
\underline{\textbf{Assets:}}\\

\textbf{Total assets}&&\underline{\underline{{\$25,333}}}\\
\\
\underline{\textbf{Liabilities and Equity:}}\\
\textbf{Liabilities:}\\
\hspace{10pt}\text{Total Liabilities}&&\text{\$8,000}\\
\textbf{Stockholders' Equity:}\\
\hspace{10pt}\text{Total Stockholder's Equity}&&\underline{\text{~~~17,333}}\\
\textbf{Total liabilities and equity}&&\underline{\underline{{~\$25,333}}}\\

\end{array}$$

## b. 

We are asked to determine how would the balance sheet look like if the current exchange ratio is 1.60 solaris per U.S. dollar. Assume that one year from now the balance sheet in solaris is exactly the same as at the beginning of the year.

In order to determine how would the balance sheet look like, we  will convert the assets, liabilities and equity in U.S. dollar. We will divide their values in solaris by the current exchange rate 1.60 solaris. To visualize: 
$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Value in \$} &= \dfrac{\text{Value in solaris}}{\text{Exchange Rate}}\\[10pt]
\end{aligned}$$

As a conclusion, the balance sheet will have a value of the assets, liabilities and equity of **$23,750, $7,500, and $16,250** respectively. To illustrate: 

$$\begin {array}{c}
\textbf{Atreides International}\\
\textbf{Balance Sheet}\\
\textbf{For the Year Ended 20YX}
\end{array}$$
$$\begin {array}{llr}
\underline{\textbf{Assets:}}\\

\textbf{Total assets}&&\underline{\underline{{\$23,750}}}\\
\\
\underline{\textbf{Liabilities and Equity:}}\\
\textbf{Liabilities:}\\
\hspace{10pt}\text{Total Liabilities}&&\text{\$7,500}\\
\textbf{Stockholders' Equity:}\\
\hspace{10pt}\text{Total Stockholder's Equity}&&\underline{\text{~~~16,250}}\\
\textbf{Total liabilities and equity}&&\underline{\underline{{~\$23,750}}}\\

\end{array}$$

## c.

We are asked to determine  how would the balance sheet look like if the current exchange ratio is 1.41 solaris per U.S. dollar. Assume that one year from now the balance sheet in solaris is exactly the same as at the beginning of the year.

In order to determine how would the balance sheet look like, we  will convert the assets, liabilities and equity in U.S. dollar. We will divide their values in solaris by the current exchange rate 1.41 solaris. To visualize: 
$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Value in \$} &= \dfrac{\text{Value in solaris}}{\text{Exchange Rate}}\\[10pt]
\end{aligned}$$

As a conclusion, the balance sheet will have a value of the assets, liabilities and equity of **$26,950.35, $8,510.64, and $18,439.72** respectively. To illustrate: 

$$\begin {array}{c}
\textbf{Atreides International}\\
\textbf{Balance Sheet}\\
\textbf{For the Year Ended 20YX}
\end{array}$$
$$\begin {array}{llr}
\underline{\textbf{Assets:}}\\

\textbf{Total assets}&&\underline{\underline{{\$26,950.35}}}\\
\\
\underline{\textbf{Liabilities and Equity:}}\\
\textbf{Liabilities:}\\
\hspace{10pt}\text{Total Liabilities}&&\text{\$8,510.63}\\
\textbf{Stockholders' Equity:}\\
\hspace{10pt}\text{Total Stockholder's Equity}&&\underline{\text{~18,439.72}}\\
\textbf{Total liabilities and equity}&&\underline{\underline{{~\$26,950.35}}}\\

\end{array}$$
To sum it all up, we have determined the value of assets, liabilities and equity in dollars by applying the different exchange rates of solaris per dollar.
